title: Locked at 60 FPS and can't change it
body:
I've been trying to League but it's always stuck at 60 FPS, I turned off V-Sync and everything that could limit it to 60 FPS, I always keep it at uncapped but it's still at 60 FPS
Even in the NVIDIA control panel, I turned off V-Sync. I looked it up before to see if anyone else had the same problem and it said something about Xbox game bar limiting it and having to turn it off to let it go free, so I tried to log into that to try and get rid of it. But it  won't let me log on to it, it kept saying "We can't sign you in right now"  and I tried everything I knew and possibly could. What should I do?

replies.body: Yeah it's the game bar through the Xbox app. That fixed it for me when it happened

It does sound like you're getting this locked FPS due to the Windows 10 game bar update. If you're not able to sign into the xbox app to disable it, you should still be able to turn it off through your settings. 

Here's a little [**guide**](https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-turn-off-game-bar-windows-10-a.html) on how you can disable that game bar!
